item.title: Deploying a hugo site on GitHub pages
item.description: When you want to deploy a static website built with the fantastic Hugo on GitHub pages, you don’t have 100 of possibilities. A clean one, and an easy one ðŸ˜„. The easy one is to build your website to the docs folder. It’s not super clean though since the source code is on the same branch as the built code. It doesn’t make diffing super great, gives a long output when you commit, you have to build at every single commit to keep consistent.
